newsitem.title: ISRAEL: PFLP supporters burn Israeli flags during protest.
newsitem.headline: PFLP supporters burn Israeli flags during protest.

text.p: Chanting "down with the olive branch, long live the gun", some 250 Palestinians marched in the West Bank on Thursday in protest at the PLO's jailing of three Arabs convicted of killing two Jewish settlers.

Witnesses said the demonstrators, supporters of the radical Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP), burned an Israeli flag during the march in the self-ruled town of Ramallah. Palestinian police stayed away from the demonstration.

A Palestinian Security Court on Wednesday sentenced two Palestinians to life imprisonment after convicting them of killing a Jewish settler and her 12-year-old son in a drive-by attack near Ramallah. A third Arab accused of driving the getaway car was jailed for 15 years.
The Damascus-based PFLP claimed responsibility for the December 11 attack.
PFLP supporters blamed Israel for pressuring the PLO to capture the gunmen and jail them.
